social_posts.post_text:
your playing small does not serve the world. 

shouts to @mariannewilliamson

i’m invigorated by the conversations that our WARTIME articles start. this is the purpose of producing a political magazine: to generate critical discussions about the issues that affect our lives and our liberation. 

our most recent digital piece highlights some of the shortcomings inherent in the belief that wealthy Black elites share the same interest in the freedom and liberation of Black people that we do. 

we believe that those peddling Black Capitalism, the “Crypto Revolution” and any number of schemes may be well meaning and some may even offer some measure of financial “freedom” but these are insufficient when the goals are revolution, liberation and power. 

We aren’t against money, or trade or entrepreneurship even. but we fundamentally believe that if any business (or business man), or economy relies on the exploitation of our people then we should call it as it is. 

lastly, we aren’t beyond working with wealthy sisters and brothers in the pursuit of our freedom but our goal isn’t to BE THEM. we see no freedom in that future. It’s bigger than that. Always will be. 

looking forward to talking to y’all about this and the many other pieces in the newest edition of WARTIME: “Money, Power, Respect.” FULL EDITION ONLINE

@blackmenbuild #LINKINBIO

“add me on linkedin”

📸: @mrjohnnyperez 
🪄: @galaxy_gives

i grew up poor.  my biggest dream as a child was to grow up to be rich.  me, my brothers, and cousins used to fantasize about buying a whole block of houses and all of us living next door to one another.  i went to famu and majored in business administration to fulfill my dream of riches...and happiness. 

i worked in corporate america for four years because i wanted to be the lender and not the borrower; the head not the tail.  i wanted my portion.  my riches.  i wanted money.  i didn't want to be poor.  i saw how people treated us, talked to us, about us, around us. so, money became the motive. 

so...I GET IT: the love of money, the glorification of wealth and the men with it.  they HAVE to be smart, right?  they HAVE to work hard, right? they HAVE to be "goals". all of us grew under the western fairy tale that is the "inevitability of capitalism": that it spurs innovation, that it is "natural", that it allows the will of the 'people' to pick winners and losers.

it's a cool story...but it's a lie.  it is savage, it is cynical, it is inhumane, it is unethical, and it was built and continues to be built on the lives and labor of Black and Indigenous people the world over. 

we must operate in the world as it is, and still remain clear that there is no freedom in it for us.  there is another way.  but we have to be clear about what we're up against. 

we're proud to offer our latest article from WARTIME which delves deeper into a very important question for us all: "What is a Capitalist?" tap in.

@blackmenbuild is serious about building a national membership organization that can move, that can win, that can make real all the plans and visions that we have. it is not easy work, it is not popular work, it is not flashy work but it is necessary. 

and we cannot do it alone. no organization can. that’s why we are excited to begin a process of partnership with @naaganational.

We both believe that it is of utmost importance that our people have all the tools necessary to defend ourselves from economic, social, political and physical exploitation.  We must arm ourselves in all aspects and our growing partnership will see us work together more over the coming months; developing workshops, trainings and more to serve our people and prepare for the times ahead.

this is just the first of many partnerships that we are journeying on this year, to grow our collective impact and be ready for what will continue to be a country in crisis throughout this decade. 

Join us for our first Joint Call on Monday March 27th at 8 PM EST.  Leaders from both of our organizations will talk about our work and joining forces at the NAAGA National Gathering in Atlanta, GA. in July!

Link in bio to RSVP 🙏🏾

#blackmenbuild #naaga #naagaconvention2023

Black Men Build has a lot in store this year. Shoutout to our Day 1s, our new followers, our future members and last but not least our 9s across the country. Black Men Build is a revolutionary organization and we are bringing Black men into the movement for racial, gender, and social justice.

Below are some of the core pillars of our work:

🪶The work starts with our Men's Circles. Brothers need a space to BE: be themselves, be in conversation, be challenged, be educated, be together. Our circles bring together men (and in some cases women) twice a month for conversation, vulnerability and sharing. This is a heart and spirit space. It is the bedrock of our programming in many cities. We have Men's Circles in Atlanta, Baltimore, Chicago, Columbus, Detroit, East St. Louis, Los Angeles, Memphis, Milwaukee, Miami, New York, St. Louis and South Jersey.

🪶 Each of our hubs are developing their own set of survival programs to serve, recruit and educate. These include: community health clinics, music training classes, self defense classes, gun safety trainings, historical tours, food pantries, the Black Men Build Chess Club, and mentoring programs for the youth in every city we are in.

🪶We believe that every BMB member, affiliate, and hub must serve as an educational center for our communities. With rampant misinformation both online and in the community, we see this as a key part of our work and fight. BMB hosts monthly Mass Calls that engage thousands of men across the country to discuss current events, politics, health, media and wealth. Our weekly Theory Thursday political sessions dive deeper into the issues that we face everyday.

🪶WARTIME is our quarterly print and digital political publication. It covers our cultural, social, and political vision and is a place for us to offer our critiques in thoughtful and creative ways on on capitalism, weed legalization, the COVID-19 pandemic, respecting Black women, community protection and much more.

Come build with us. Link in bio to become a member 🙏🏾

what a joy it is to sit in circles with my brothers every two weeks; to have a space to be vulnerable, to rejoice, to mourn, to laugh, to imagine, to sharpen, to debate. this space has become key to my teetering, tentative, precarious sense of sanity over the last two years and I’m grateful.  yesterday we had an 11 year old and a brother well into his 80’s. 

far too many see the circle as a “soft” space, completely separate from the “real” work. we see it different. the circle is central to our work. it’s the foundation for our power, the bedrock of our politics. Yes, it’s slower, not as flashy, not as glittery but the fruit from these trees are the source of national nourishment, infrastructure and power. 

peace, love, power to our miami lead organizer @gunder_the_god, facilitator @calvinearlyspeaks and the team here and across the country that are building this thing methodically, with movement on they mind. peace love and power to the nines.

@tougaloocollege served as a refuge for activists during the Civil Rights Movement and became a central gathering place for organizers in Mississippi. last week, I had the honor of delivering the Convocation Keynote in the pulpit of the historic Woodworth Chapel joining luminaries like Ralph Bunche, Julian Bond, Stokely Carmichael, James Baldwin, Martin Luther King, Jr., Medgar Evers, Fannie Lou Hamer, Harry Belafonte, Leontyne Price and so many more.  i felt their spirits and sought to be a worthy vessel.  it was my first speech in over a year and i felt at home.  much thanks to Tougaloo College and its incredible student body for having me.  much love to my SNCC Veteran family as well.  see you all soon.

the @blackmenbuild MASS CALL is our monthly tap in on the issues that are relevant to our People and politics. every month hundreds of us come together to hear real analysis beyond sound bites, half truths and click bait. this month is our 27th Installment of the series 🔥💨🙌🏿😶‍🌫️😤. Pull up. 

The news cycle may move on but the WORK continues. 

Join Brothers from around the country as we roll up and get reminded about the ongoing issues and work in our neighborhoods from LA to East St. Louis, Memphis to Miami and everywhere in between.

We'll have leaders on the ground discussing:

- The aftermath of Tyre Nichols and Memphis police retaliating against their citizens after the indictment of the 5 officers.

- The impact of Stop Cop City demonstrations in Atlanta and across the country.

- The ongoing Jackson water crisis.

- Weed Decriminalization work.

They say the world is on fire so let's burn one and figure out how to get down with the local moves.  Let's release some stress, stay informed and continue to build. See yall on 4/20.

today, upon hearing of your departure from a world that you helped mold; i am sad, i am grateful, i am hopeful. 

i am sad that i didn’t get to see you these last few years, that the pandemic robbed us of some laughs and lessons. 

i am grateful that @msladyjustice1 gave me the opportunity to speak to you this year. to tell you how important you have been to me, to my life, to my sense of purpose, to my feelings of hope and perseverance throughout the toughest time that I've faced.  In the moments where I feel the most lost, the most useless, the most dejected, I recall our conversations, I think about the light in your eyes, your smile, your voice, your encouragement, your questions, and your graciousness with me.  

I will never forget our first meeting, for as long as I have memories.   

I remember that day like it was yesterday.  Seeing you step into the office; you coming to join our little group and sit attentively as we spoke of our plans for "revolution".    It was at that moment, that I knew that I was on the right path.  Over the years, you have remained such a powerful centering place for me, even in times when we weren't communicating. 

I am so very grateful to you and for you.  You changed my life in so many ways and I cherish every conversation that we have shared, every moment that I have had to sit at your feet and pick your brain or jog your memory, has stayed with me.
 
I am hopeful because you still live in the heart of our movement, that you have given so much to us all and that your legacy is intact.  I hope to one day live up to whatever it was that you saw in me on that day almost ten years ago.  I love you Mr. B and I will keep fighting until I can't anymore.  

Long Live Harry Belafonte. Deep love to every person that you put in my path! @thenjiwetameika @tymcharris @lsarsour @peacegina @michaelskolnik and so many more. Aluta Continua!

for three years we have been refining and growing our organization. it’s been so hard at times to stay the course, to maintain the mission. 

but we’ve kept at it. 

one of the sustaining forces of our organization has been our Men’s Circles.  these are the bedrock of our work and the tip of our spear as we build this thing. 

we’re excited to bring what have been our local Circles to Brothers around the country, to experience (virtually) the transformative practice of building, connecting, opening, and healing with one another. 

The organization we are building and the work we are doing isn’t about transaction; it’s about transforming us into a political force that can fight and win. 

please share this with the men in your lives, connect them with us. we want as many brothers of all ages to experience this with us. 

these circles will anchor 25 new chapters this year. peace, love, and power to the NINES. @blackmenbuild

this saturday @blackmenbuild is inviting you to join us for our first national men’s circle. brothers, you need this. pop in, see what it’s about. sisters, send this to the men in your lives. see you saturday afternoon.

over the past year, improv has allowed me to stretch and process and grieve and laugh. i’m grateful that i have it in my life even if i haven’t gotten approached by Saturday Night Live yet 🥹. i’m super proud to be a part of our Juneteenth show, two weeks from tonight. we gonna give y’all an incredible show: some singin’, lots of laughing, and a whole lotta truth about this shitshow we call a country. shouts to @unrulyviki and @noel8leon for their work in putting this show together.

in one week we will honor the life of my brother @danny_basquiat. viewing on saturday night. all are welcome. thankful to every single one of you that have messaged me. im broken but still here. love y’all.

tomorrow is a celebration of life. there will be tears, shatterings, pain. but my bro must be sent home with praise, memories, songs. more life. Long live. 

if you can’t make it, tune in to the love stream. 

LIVE STREAM LINK IN MY BIO. ❤️🖤
headed to the Bay to live free.
TOMORROW NIGHT, join @blackmenbuild, @kambalem and @btnewsroom’s @eugene4dc as we discuss the political context on the Continent. you don’t wanna miss this conversation.

one week away from joining hundreds in Atlanta to discuss the promise, possibility and power of a Socialist future. i am deeply honored to be joining a STACKED panel on “Socialism and Democracy” with comrades from across the country. 

to all my Atlanta homies, that’s thinking WTF is Socialism and why Phil talk about it all the time, come through for the day and see. then we can kick it later 😈. 

there’s no better time than now to envision a new way of being in this world for our children. i hope to see you next week.

Capitalism, White Supremacy, Patriarchy are death dealing ideologies.  Each are invested in soul stifling miseducation, alienation, and dehumanization. Capitalism and imperialism idolizes the individual, the self made man, the conniving conqueror, the stoic sterile statesman. It hates the “other”, the queer, the radical. 

They teach us that our meaning, or reason for being is in money and consumption and domination and in silence and lies and amnesia. They tell us these are the things that will make us happy. 

But Make no mistake, there is no love to be found in the empire. 

Our answer is a movement and organizations built on political education that gives context beyond content, a movement that forges human connection and intimacy, a movement that rehumanizes and remembers, that dances and sings, that tells stories and tells no lies, that is joyful and allows us - as my sister @maryhooks says - to be transformed in the service of the work. 

To me, in addition to everything we know about socialism and democracy: these are ideologies of love, of unlocking the magic and messiness inherent in our human experience. 

Cuban revolutionary and writer Jose Marti once said “Our wine is bitter, but it is our wine.”

a socialist future is a democratic one, is a liberating one, is an abundant one; is above all else a human one, with all its complexities and hardships. 

the journey before us will not be easy, but the future is ours. and it’s worth every minute spent fighting for it. 

grateful to join @mariahforathens, @communitymovementbuilders, #stopcopcity, @pslnational, @peoplesforumnyc, @blackallianceforpeace and many others to imagine a new world and learn from those fighting for that world.

still struggling to understand 2023. the meaning amongst the madness of it. 

why i feel so confused by some things, sometimes. 

why i feel out of place, out of step, out of body, out of time, sometimes. 

why i don’t know me like i feel like i used to know me, sometimes. 

sometimes, i don’t understand any of it. 

2023 tryna teach me things. about grief and loss, spirit and body, love and loneliness. 

but shit, it’s hard to hear the message in the middle of the muck, sometimes. 

sometimes when i can clear the mud from my mind and ears, i hear zora: “there are years that ask questions and years that answer….”

idk wtf this year be about. 

but, everything’s gonna be alright. 
 
and everything ain’t meant to be understood, sometimes. 

📷: @iamsquint

excited to announce that I'll be hitting the stage at the legendary 2023 @a3cfestival to drop some knowledge, rep @blackmenbuild & @stopcopcity #stopcopcity and share my journey on the stage at 1pm tomorrow afternoon with @marclamonthill @chasinggarza @moniqueamitchell and @angelarye. 

Head over to www.A3CConference.com now and grab your ticket while they last. big shouts to @briaunalavonne_ for the vision and love. 

#A3CConference #ForTheCulture #A3C2023
Honored and looking forward to be joining @gogreenfashionista and an incredible lineup of speakers and artists tomorrow night for #indigenouspeoplesday.

SEASON 5 KICKOFF!! Join us as we launch *FILANTHROPY as part of Fitness + Financial Gains Season 5 !! 

#FFGains Community Beach Vinyāsa Yoga + Meditation & Beach Cleanup hosted by Coach Aileen (@aileenmcgraw), Certified Yoga Instructor + Coach Sukii (@saysukii ), Organizer & Philanthropist, in partnership with Phil Agnew (@philsomething ) & The Poetry Potluck (@thepoetrypotluck). 

Join FITNESS + FINANCIAL GAINS special guests/friends as we host a community all-levels yoga + meditation class with a beach clean up to follow! Proceeds of this event will go to Go Fund Me in honor of Danny Agnew’s legacy: https://gofund.me/82fcbd76.

* Link in bio to purchase tickets: https://season5kickoff.eventbrite.com

Date: Saturday, October 14, 2023

Time: 9 am - Noon
9am arrival networking; 9:30 am: yoga begins; 11 am: beach cleanup begins

Location: Meeting at the beach access 77th Street + Collins Avenue

What to bring: *Yoga mat and water. We will be in the sun/shade - be mindful to wear light comfortable clothes, sunglasses, hat, etc.

What you can expect: All levels welcome. This is a low impact workout. In this yoga class you will build strength and flexibility through an energizing vinyāsa flow, coupled with a gentle wind-down. Post workout we will clean the beach along the shore - gloves and trash bags will be provided.

Follow @FitnessFinancialGains on IG for most up to date event details.

Hope to see you there!
- IG: @jessykathemodel 

#fitnessfinancialgains #ffgains #ffgains5 #ffgainsy2s1 #miamifitness #miamiphilanthropy #fitnessfilanthropyfinancialgains #northmiamibeach #miamiyoga #beachcleanup #saturdayswithjessyka #sofloliving #blackmenbuild

“I’m really excited to be out here today with @fitnessfinancialgains because @jessykathemodel is a force of nature. And this movement is really about bringing people together. Not just to uplift themselves but to uplift the community. Those were the things that Danny was about. Those were the things that I’m about. @blackmenbuild is working every day to get brothers from around the country to get involved in politics, more involved in their home + in their community + in their families, and most important to get us more involved in ourselves. To understand our interior worlds - to connect with other brothers / sisters in a deeper level.”

“And my brother who is not here in the flesh with us anymore but is absolutely here in spirit was absolutely all about that. That was what me and him moved to Miami for. To always be about the business of uplifting and ensure that the people that are have nots understand the system in a way that allows them to move campaigns, to move organizations, to move ourselves, to better lives - to better existences in Miami and across the country.”

“I’m really excited to be here. This was an incredible turnout - in the rain. & really excited to partner with @jessykathemodel + @fitnessfinancialgains on a growing movement for people like myself who have moved to Miami  like myself 11 years ago to people who are from Miami”. …
- @philsomething , Co-Director of @blackmenbuild + the older brother of the Late Great, @danny_basquiat Founder of @roots_collective 

Please continue to hold the Agnew Family in your hearts and we will continue to support the Legacy Fund all season. Donation link available in bio and here: https://www.gofundme.com/f/celebrate-the-life-of-danny-agnew

With gratitude, 
#FFGAINS Family 🫶🏾✨

🎥: @vallonierstudios @reubenharper

#fitnessfinancialgains #ffgains #ffgains5 #ffgainsy2s1 #miamifitness #miamiphilanthropy #fitnessfilanthropyfinancialgains #northmiamibeach #miamiyoga #beachcleanup #saturdayswithjessyka #sofloliving #blackmenbuild #rootscollective #rootsblackhouse #beachmeditation

9 years ago, i traveled with comrades for our first @thedreamdefenders delegation to Palestine. there, i witnessed firsthand the brutality and inhumanity of the apartheid state of Israel. as a Black American, it was both foreign and familiar. one feels as if they are living in the past, present, and future of America all at once. 

i also listened to the brilliant poetry of an unbroken Palestinian boy, the liberated artistry of once-silenced Palestinian girls, saw the unapologetic paintings of an affable artist-turned-activist.  I dined in the home of a woman who lost her unborn child to brutal Israeli occupation; a life snuffed out before it’s first breath.

now the world is watching as Israel continues its decades long pattern of ethic cleansing, genocide and displacement. 

there’s those that continue to ask why Black people should care. my answer is: WE ALWAYS CARE. no matter who, no matter where. we care. about Palestine, India, South America, Haiti, and yes the entire mother CONTINENT of Africa. WE CARE. wherever people are rising up, we care. we care about it all. we are internationalists. if anybody says otherwise, they are unfit for leadership. 

today we demand a ceasefire. thousands are losing their lives here and around the world because of this empire. it must end. now. #freepalestine🇵🇸

Our Literacy is Liberation Conference ✊🏾📚was AMAZING! From our wonderful & empowering keynote speaker, @philsomething to each and EVERY food vendor (@chrissy.cuisine @mpxdetroit & @mikeskg )! We were able to offer about 100 free massages throughout the day, had Detroit’s youngest author @bittyg4 there to inspire our little ones, and NINE powerful workshops (@brilliantdetroit @313reads @miedjusticecoalition & more) that y’all will hear more about on our page 🔥🔥

THANK YOU to all who attended, and please know that this is just the beginning of building power to improve literacy across this city, state, and country for ALL of our children ❤️✊🏾📚

Update from the @thefreedomlab_miami  WE LOVE YOU DANNY! (@danny_basquiat ) 

We promised our brother we will COMPLETE THE MISSION! And we are committed to that! @village.free.dge_ @philsomething @blackmenbuildmiami @theblkcollective @smiletrustinc #BlackMiami #RootsCollective #FreedomLab

in the midst of it all, i returned home to @famu_1887 with the class of @famu2xx3. i was reminded - yet again - why i’m forever indebted to this school, to my classmates, to my frat brothers @bnorbeout, to my tribe. 

when you see me, you see them. 

i was a scared, insecure boy in tall tees and fake diamond earrings. i knew nothing about anything: business, fraternities, sororities, women, florida. i felt so alone, so lost, so fucking excited. 

famu saved my life, saw me, loved me, molded this misshapen lump of clay into someone with a confidence, a belief in myself and in black people that’s unshakable. 

i’m forever grateful to every rattler that hugged me hard, offered condolences, expressed some pride in some thing that I’ve accomplished. I love y’all. thank you for lifting me up when I didn’t even know I needed it. 

And shout out to @robynmowatt and @bigbeevisuals for letting me be cozy in @essence. 

FAMU IS AND ALWAYS WILL BE HEAVEN IN EARTH WITH THE BADDEST BAND IN ALL THE LAND AND THE NUMBER ONE UNIVERSITY IN THE WORLD. period.

It’s show time, and we are bringing the entire community out Let’s Gooooooo 🚨🚨🚨🚨

🚨 WARTIME SPECIAL EDITION (FALL 2023) LOCATION PICK UP 🚨

This fall we dropped our latest edition of WARTIME, @blackmenbuild’s award winning political publication. it is a labor of deep love producing each one.  there are so many lies, half truths, and fake scholars out here. we have an obligation to think critically about this moment and what we must do to evolve and transform. 

In this Special Edition, we present a condensed version of our full length publication – featuring a sixteen-page, tabloid-style newspaper. This issue focuses on the current political moment we find ourselves in and honors Black August, our political prisoners and the thousands of prisoners of war. 

➡️ Scroll thru to find out where you can pick up a FREE copy of WARTIME in your city. More information coming later this week on additional cities 🙏🏾

Link in bio to download the digital version of WARTIME 🔗

#blackmenbuild #wartime #milwaukee #miami #newyork #brooklyn #stlouis #losangeles

sometimes you dream a dream for many years of nights. and often, no matter how many times you’ve dreamed that dream, it can be hard to put words to it when you’re awake. and then, one morning you’re sitting in a circle in a gym with close to 100 men and fathers and it hits you. this is the dream. i know this room, i smelled it before. I’ve been here before.  the words still fail me but the feelings remain. 

this morning, @blaquepicasso led the charge for an awe-some gathering of brothers. at 7 am on a Friday over 100 black and Latino men and fathers came together to talk, learn and share. this was a powerful room, a loving room, a dangerous room. because @blackmenbuildmiami was there, leading our Men’s Circles. 

everytime we start a Circle, there’s a bit of doubt in my head: “is anybody gonna talk?” “they gon’ think this shit stupid…”. and every time - without fail - my doubts prove foolish. we opened up. we shared. shed tears. we told each other “i love you and i’m proud of you”. My God. the Circle is undefeated. it is the tip of the spear, the tip of the iceberg. 

next year we’re gonna need each other more than ever. it’s gonna be a scary one. but @blackmenbuild coming.

our last @blackmenbuildmiami men’s circle of the year. 

next year, @blackmenbuild will have monthly circles in no less than twenty cities around the country. these are spaces of transformation, education, vulnerability and more. each of these cities will also provide monthly political education, daily WARTIME availability, service and survival programs and more to meet what will be crisis like moments in our communities. 

the coming year will challenge our communities in so many ways. black men build brothers are preparing for these challenges; not with black capitalism, or adventurism, or faux intellectualism, or lies, or pseudoscience. but with love, accountability, healing,  organization, consistency and strategy. and love. did i say love?

to each and every black men build member, i love you and i am proud of you. to Phillip Agnew: i love you and i am proud of you. i don’t say either enough.
@blackmenbuild
